element.name: SUCCESS
element.description: The request succeeded

element.name: UNSUPPORTED_REQUEST
element.description: The request is not supported by the headunit

element.name: UNSUPPORTED_RESOURCE
element.description: A button that was requested for subscription is not supported under the current system.

element.name: DISALLOWED
element.description: RPC is not authorized in local policy table.

element.name: REJECTED
element.description: The requested command was rejected, e.g. because mobile app is in background and cannot perform any HMI commands. Or an HMI command (e.g. Speak) is rejected because a higher priority HMI command (e.g. Alert) is playing.

element.name: ABORTED
element.description: A command was aborted, for example due to user interaction (e.g. user pressed button). Or an HMI command (e.g. Speak) is aborted because a higher priority HMI command (e.g. Alert) was requested.

element.name: IGNORED
element.description: A command was ignored, because the intended result is already in effect. For example, SetMediaClockTimer was used to pause the media clock although the clock is paused already. NOTE: potentially replaces SUBSCRIBED_ALREADY

element.name: RETRY
element.description: The user interrupted the RPC (e.g. PerformAudioPassThru) and indicated to start over. Note, the app must issue the new RPC.

element.name: IN_USE
element.description: The data may not be changed, because it is currently in use. For example when trying to delete a command set that is currently involved in an interaction.

element.name: VEHICLE_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE
element.description: The requested vehicle data is not available on this vehicle or is not published.

element.name: TIMED_OUT
element.description: Overlay reached the maximum timeout and closed.

element.name: INVALID_DATA
element.description: The data sent is invalid. For example: Invalid Json syntax Parameters out of bounds (number or enum range) Mandatory parameters not provided Parameter provided with wrong type Invalid characters Empty string

element.name: INVALID_ID
element.description: One of the provided IDs is not valid. For example This applies to CorrelationID, SubscriptionID, CommandID, MenuID, etc.

element.name: DUPLICATE_NAME
element.description: There was a conflict with an registered name (application or menu item) or vr command

element.name: APPLICATION_NOT_REGISTERED
element.description: An command can not be executed because no application has been registered with RegisterApplication.

element.name: WRONG_LANGUAGE
element.description: The requested language is currently not supported. Might be because of a mismatch of the currently active language on the headunit and the requested language

element.name: OUT_OF_MEMORY
element.description: The system could not process the request because the necessary memory couldn't be allocated

element.name: TOO_MANY_PENDING_REQUESTS
element.description: There are too many requests pending (means, that the response has not been delivered, yet).There may be a maximum of 1000 pending requests at a time.

element.name: TOO_MANY_APPLICATIONS
element.description: There are already too many registered applications

element.name: APPLICATION_REGISTERED_ALREADY
element.description: RegisterApplication has been called again, after a RegisterApplication was successful before.

element.name: WARNINGS
element.description: The RPC (e.g. SubscribeVehicleData) executed successfully but one or more items have a warning or failure.

element.name: GENERIC_ERROR
element.description: Provided data is valid but something went wrong in the lower layers.

element.name: USER_DISALLOWED
element.description: RPC is included in a functional group explicitly blocked by the user.

element.name: TRUNCATED_DATA
element.description: The RPC (e.g. ReadDID) executed successfully but the data exceeded the platform maximum threshold and thus, only part of the data is available.

element.name: UNSUPPORTED_VERSION
element.description: Sync doesn't support the protocol that is requested by the mobile application

element.name: VEHICLE_DATA_NOT_ALLOWED
element.description: The user has turned off access to vehicle data, and it is globally unavailable to mobile applications.

element.name: FILE_NOT_FOUND
element.description: A specified file could not be found on the headunit.

element.name: CANCEL_ROUTE
element.description: User selected to Cancel Route.

element.name: SAVED
element.description: The RPC (e.g. Slider) executed successfully and the user elected to save the current position / value.

element.name: INVALID_CERT
element.description: The certificate provided during authentication is invalid.

element.name: EXPIRED_CERT
element.description: The certificate provided during authentication is expired.

element.name: RESUME_FAILED
element.description: The provided hash ID does not match the hash of the current set of registered data or the core could not resume the previous data.

element.name: DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE
element.description: The requested information is currently not available. This is different than UNSUPPORTED_RESOURCE because it implies the data is at some point available.

element.name: READ_ONLY
element.description: The value being set is read only

element.name: CORRUPTED_DATA
element.description: The data sent failed to pass CRC check in receiver end

element.name: LONG
element.description: A button was released, after it was pressed for a long time Actual timing is defined by the headunit and may vary

element.name: SHORT
element.description: A button was released, after it was pressed for a short time Actual timing is defined by the headunit and may vary

element.name: BUTTONUP
element.description: A button has been released up

element.name: BUTTONDOWN
element.description: A button has been pressed down

enum.name: UpdateMode
enum.description: Describes how the media clock timer should behave on the platform

element.name: COUNTUP
element.description: Starts the media clock timer counting upwards, as in time elapsed.

element.name: COUNTDOWN
element.description: Starts the media clock timer counting downwards, as in time remaining.

element.name: PAUSE
element.description: Pauses the media clock timer

element.name: RESUME
element.description: Resume the media clock timer

element.name: CLEAR
element.description: Clears the media clock timer (previously done through Show->mediaClock)

element.name: UP
element.description: Causes the media clock timer to update from 0:00 to a specified time

element.name: DOWN
element.description: Causes the media clock timer to update from a specified time to 0:00

element.name: NONE
element.description: Indicates to not use the media clock timer

enum.name: InteractionMode
enum.description: For application-requested interactions, this mode indicates the method in which the user is notified and uses the interaction.

element.name: MANUAL_ONLY
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to only occur on the display, meaning the choices are provided only via the display. No Voice Interaction.

element.name: VR_ONLY
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to only occur using the headunits VR system. Selections are made by saying the command.

element.name: BOTH
element.description: This mode causes both a VR and display selection option for an interaction. The user will first be asked via Voice Interaction (if available). If this is unsuccessful, the system will switch to manual input.

enum.name: LayoutMode
enum.description: For touchscreen interactions, the mode of how the choices are presented.

element.name: ICON_ONLY
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to display the previous set of choices as icons.

element.name: ICON_WITH_SEARCH
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to display the previous set of choices as icons along with a search field in the HMI.

element.name: LIST_ONLY
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to display the previous set of choices as a list.

element.name: LIST_WITH_SEARCH
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to display the previous set of choices as a list along with a search field in the HMI.

element.name: KEYBOARD
element.description: This mode causes the interaction to immediately display a keyboard entry through the HMI.

enum.name: HMILevel
enum.description: Enumeration that describes current levels of HMI.

enum.name: AudioStreamingState
enum.description: Enumeration that describes possible states of audio streaming.

enum.name: SystemAction
enum.description: Enumeration that describes system actions that can be triggered.

element.name: DEFAULT_ACTION
element.description: Default action occurs. Standard behavior (e.g. SoftButton clears overlay).

element.name: STEAL_FOCUS
element.description: App is brought into HMI_FULL.

element.name: KEEP_CONTEXT
element.description: Current system context is maintained. An overlay is persisted even though a SoftButton has been pressed and the notification sent.

enum.name: SystemContext
enum.description: Enumeration that describes possible contexts an app's HMI might be in. Communicated to whichever app is in HMI FULL, except Alert.

element.name: MAIN
element.description: The app's persistent display (whether media/non-media/navigation) is fully visible onscreen.

element.name: VRSESSION
element.description: The system is currently in a VR session (with whatever dedicated VR screen being overlaid onscreen).

element.name: MENU
element.description: The system is currently displaying an in-App menu onscreen.

element.name: HMI_OBSCURED
element.description: The app's display HMI is currently being obscured by either a system or other app's overlay.

element.name: ALERT
element.description: Broadcast only to whichever app has an alert currently being displayed.

enum.name: VideoStreamingState
enum.description: Enumeration that describes possible states of video streaming.

enum.name: VrCapabilities

element.name: 16_BIT

enum.name: VideoStreamingProtocol
enum.description: Enum for each type of video streaming protocol type.

element.name: RAW
element.description: Raw stream bytes that contains no timestamp data and is the lowest supported video streaming

element.name: RTP
element.description: RTP facilitates the transfer of real-time data. Information provided by this protocol include timestamps (for synchronization), sequence numbers (for packet loss and reordering detection) and the payload format which indicates the encoded format of the data.

element.name: RTSP
element.description: The transmission of streaming data itself is not a task of RTSP. Most RTSP servers use the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) in conjunction with Real-time Control Protocol (RTCP) for media stream delivery. However, some vendors implement proprietary transport protocols.

element.name: RTMP
element.description: Real-Time Messaging Protocol (RTMP) was initially a proprietary protocol developed by Macromedia for streaming audio, video and data over the Internet, between a Flash player and a server. Macromedia is now owned by Adobe, which has released an incomplete version of the specification of the protocol for public use.

element.name: WEBM
element.description: The WebM container is based on a profile of Matroska. WebM initially supported VP8 video and Vorbis audio streams. In 2013 it was updated to accommodate VP9 video and Opus audio.

enum.name: VideoStreamingCodec
enum.description: Enum for each type of video streaming codec.

element.name: H264
element.description: A block-oriented motion-compensation-based video compression standard. As of 2014 it is one of the most commonly used formats for the recording, compression, and distribution of video content.

element.name: H265
element.description: High Efficiency Video Coding (HEVC), also known as H.265 and MPEG-H Part 2, is a video compression standard, one of several potential successors to the widely used AVC (H.264 or MPEG-4 Part 10). In comparison to AVC, HEVC offers about double the data compression ratio at the same level of video quality, or substantially improved video quality at the same bit rate. It supports resolutions up to 8192x4320, including 8K UHD.

element.name: Theora
element.description: Theora is derived from the formerly proprietary VP3 codec, released into the public domain by On2 Technologies. It is broadly comparable in design and bitrate efficiency to MPEG-4 Part 2, early versions of Windows Media Video, and RealVideo while lacking some of the features present in some of these other codecs. It is comparable in open standards philosophy to the BBC's Dirac codec.

element.name: VP8
element.description: VP8 can be multiplexed into the Matroska-based container format WebM along with Vorbis and Opus audio. The image format WebP is based on VP8's intra-frame coding. VP8's direct successor, VP9, and the emerging royalty-free internet video format AV1 from the Alliance for Open Media (AOMedia) are based on VP8.

element.name: VP9
element.description: Similar to VP8, but VP9 is customized for video resolutions beyond high-definition video (UHD) and also enables lossless compression.

element.name: PLAY_PAUSE
element.description: Default playback indicator. By default the playback indicator should be PLAY_PAUSE when: - the media app is newly registered on the head unit (after RegisterAppInterface) - the media app was closed by the user (App enters HMI_NONE) - the app sends SetMediaClockTimer with audioStreamingIndicator not set to any value

element.name: PLAY
element.description: Indicates that a button press of the Play/Pause button starts the audio playback.

element.name: PAUSE
element.description: Indicates that a button press of the Play/Pause button pauses the current audio playback.

element.name: STOP
element.description: Indicates that a button press of the Play/Pause button stops the current audio playback.

enum.name: VehicleDataResultCode
enum.description: Enumeration that describes possible result codes of a vehicle data entry request.

element.name: SUCCESS
element.description: Individual vehicle data item / DTC / DID request or subscription successful

element.name: TRUNCATED_DATA
element.description: DTC / DID request successful, however, not all active DTCs or full contents of DID location available

element.name: DISALLOWED
element.description: This vehicle data item is not allowed for this app by Ford.

element.name: USER_DISALLOWED
element.description: The user has not granted access to this type of vehicle data item at this time.

element.name: INVALID_ID
element.description: The ECU ID referenced is not a valid ID on the bus / system.

element.name: VEHICLE_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE
element.description: The requested vehicle data item / DTC / DID is not currently available or responding on the bus / system.

element.name: DATA_ALREADY_SUBSCRIBED
element.description: The vehicle data item is already subscribed.

element.name: DATA_NOT_SUBSCRIBED
element.description: The vehicle data item cannot be unsubscribed because it is not currently subscribed.

element.name: IGNORED
element.description: The request for this item is ignored because it is already in progress.

param.name: y
param.description: The y coordinate of the touch.

param.name: id
param.description: A touch's unique identifier. The application can track the current touch events by id. If a touch event has type begin, the id should be added to the set of touches. If a touch event has type end, the id should be removed from the set of touches.

param.name: ts
param.description: The time that the touch was recorded. This number can the time since the beginning of the session or something else as long as the units are in milliseconds. The timestamp is used to determined the rate of change of position of a touch. The application also uses the time to verify whether two touches, with different ids, are part of a single action by the user. If there is only a single timestamp in this array, it is the same for every coordinate in the coordinates array.

param.description: The button supports a short press. Whenever the button is pressed short, onButtonPressed( SHORT) will be invoked.

param.name: longPressAvailable
param.description: The button supports a LONG press. Whenever the button is pressed long, onButtonPressed( LONG) will be invoked.

param.name: upDownAvailable
param.description: The button supports "button down" and "button up". Whenever the button is pressed, onButtonEvent( DOWN) will be invoked. Whenever the button is released, onButtonEvent( UP) will be invoked.

param.description: The button supports a short press. Whenever the button is pressed short, onButtonPressed( SHORT) will be invoked.

param.description: The button supports "button down" and "button up". Whenever the button is pressed, onButtonEvent( DOWN) will be invoked. Whenever the button is released, onButtonEvent( UP) will be invoked.

param.description: The button supports referencing a static or dynamic image.

param.description: Position within the items that are are at top level of the in application menu. 0 will insert at the front. 1 will insert at the second position. if position is greater or equal than the number of items on top level, the sub menu will be appended to the end. If this param was omitted the entry will be added at the end.

enum.description: Enumeration listing possible keyboard events.

enum.name: KeypressMode
enum.description: Enumeration listing possible keyboard events.

element.name: SINGLE_KEYPRESS
element.description: Each keypress is individually sent as the user presses the keyboard keys.

element.name: QUEUE_KEYPRESSES
element.description: The keypresses are queued and a string is eventually sent once the user chooses to submit their entry.

element.name: RESEND_CURRENT_ENTRY
element.description: The keypresses are queue and a string is sent each time the user presses a keyboard key; the string contains the entire current entry.

struct.name: EqualizerSettings
struct.description: Defines the each Equalizer channel settings.

param.name: channelName
param.description: read-only channel / frequency name (e.i. "Treble, Midrange, Bass" or "125 Hz")

param.name: channelSetting
param.description: Reflects the setting, from 0%-100%.

param.name: source
param.description: In a getter response or a notification, it is the current primary audio source of the system. In a setter request, it is the target audio source that the system shall switch to. If the value is MOBILE_APP, the system shall switch to the mobile media app that issues the setter RPC.

param.name: keepContext
param.description: This parameter shall not be present in any getter responses or notifications. This parameter is optional in a setter request. The default value is false if it is not included. If it is false, the system not only changes the audio source but also brings the default application or system UI associated with the audio source to foreground. If it is true, the system only changes the audio source, but keeps the current application in foreground.

param.name: volume
param.description: Reflects the volume of audio, from 0%-100%.

param.name: equalizerSettings
param.description: Defines the list of supported channels (band) and their current/desired settings on HMI

param.name: moduleName
param.description: The short friendly name of the light control module. It should not be used to identify a module by mobile application.

param.name: sourceAvailable
param.description: Availability of the control of audio source.

param.name: keepContextAvailable
param.description: Availability of the keepContext parameter.

param.name: volumeAvailable
param.description: Availability of the control of audio volume.

param.name: equalizerAvailable
param.description: Availability of the control of Equalizer Settings.

param.name: equalizerMaxChannelId
param.description: Must be included if equalizerAvailable=true, and assume all IDs starting from 1 to this value are valid

element.name: HIGH_BEAMS
element.description: Include all high beam lights: front_left and front_right.

element.name: LOW_BEAMS
element.description: Include all low beam lights: front_left and front_right.

element.name: FOG_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all fog lights: front_left, front_right, rear_left and rear_right.

element.name: RUNNING_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all daytime running lights: front_left and front_right.

element.name: PARKING_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all parking lights: front_left and front_right.

element.name: BRAKE_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all brake lights: rear_left and rear_right.

element.name: LEFT_TURN_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all left turn signal lights: front_left, rear_left, left_side and mirror_mounted.

element.name: RIGHT_TURN_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all right turn signal lights: front_right, rear_right, right_side and mirror_mounted.

element.name: HAZARD_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all hazard lights: front_left, front_right, rear_left and rear_right.

element.name: REAR_CARGO_LIGHTS
element.description: Cargo lamps illuminate the cargo area.

element.name: REAR_TRUCK_BED_LIGHTS
element.description: Truck bed lamps light up the bed of the truck.

element.name: REAR_TRAILER_LIGHTS
element.description: Trailer lights are lamps mounted on a trailer hitch.

element.name: LEFT_SPOT_LIGHTS
element.description: It is the spotlights mounted on the left side of a vehicle.

element.name: RIGHT_SPOT_LIGHTS
element.description: It is the spotlights mounted on the right side of a vehicle.

element.name: LEFT_PUDDLE_LIGHTS
element.description: Puddle lamps illuminate the ground beside the door as the customer is opening or approaching the door.

element.name: RIGHT_PUDDLE_LIGHTS
element.description: Puddle lamps illuminate the ground beside the door as the customer is opening or approaching the door.

element.name: EXTERIOR_FRONT_LIGHTS
element.description: Include exterior lights located in front of the vehicle. For example, fog lights and low beams.

element.name: EXTERIOR_REAR_LIGHTS
element.description: Include exterior lights located at the back of the vehicle. For example, license plate lights, reverse lights, cargo lights, bed lights and trailer assist lights.

element.name: EXTERIOR_LEFT_LIGHTS
element.description: Include exterior lights located at the left side of the vehicle. For example, left puddle lights and spot lights.

element.name: EXTERIOR_RIGHT_LIGHTS
element.description: Include exterior lights located at the right side of the vehicle. For example, right puddle lights and spot lights.

element.name: EXTERIOR_ALL_LIGHTS
element.description: Include all exterior lights around the vehicle.

param.name: statusAvailable
param.description: Indicates if the status (ON/OFF) can be set remotely. App shall not use read-only values (RAMP_UP/RAMP_DOWN/UNKNOWN/INVALID) in a setInteriorVehicleData request.

param.name: densityAvailable
param.description: Indicates if the light's density can be set remotely (similar to a dimmer).

param.name: rgbColorSpaceAvailable
param.description: Indicates if the light's color can be set remotely by using the sRGB color space.

param.description: The name of a light or a group of lights.

param.name: lightState
param.description: An array of LightNames and their current or desired status. No change to the status of the LightNames that are not listed in the array.

struct.name: MediaServiceData
struct.description: This data is related to what a media service should provide

param.name: mediaType
param.description: The type of the currently playing or paused track.

param.name: mediaTitle
param.description: Music: The name of the current track Podcast: The name of the current episode Audiobook: The name of the current chapter

param.name: mediaArtist
param.description: Music: The name of the current album artist Podcast: The provider of the podcast (hosts, network, company) Audiobook: The book author's name

param.name: mediaAlbum
param.description: Music: The name of the current album Podcast: The name of the current podcast show Audiobook: The name of the current book

param.name: playlistName
param.description: Music: The name of the playlist or radio station, if the user is playing from a playlist, otherwise, Null Podcast: The name of the playlist, if the user is playing from a playlist, otherwise, Null Audiobook: Likely not applicable, possibly a collection or "playlist" of books

param.name: isExplicit
param.description: Whether or not the content currently playing (e.g. the track, episode, or book) contains explicit content

param.name: trackPlaybackProgress
param.description: Music: The current progress of the track in seconds Podcast: The current progress of the episode in seconds Audiobook: The current progress of the current segment (e.g. the chapter) in seconds

param.name: trackPlaybackDuration
param.description: Music: The total duration of the track in seconds Podcast: The total duration of the episode in seconds Audiobook: The total duration of the current segment (e.g. the chapter) in seconds

param.name: queuePlaybackProgress
param.description: Music: The current progress of the playback queue in seconds Podcast: The current progress of the playback queue in seconds Audiobook: The current progress of the playback queue (e.g. the book) in seconds

param.name: queuePlaybackDuration
param.description: Music: The total duration of the playback queue in seconds Podcast: The total duration of the playback queue in seconds Audiobook: The total duration of the playback queue (e.g. the book) in seconds

param.name: queueCurrentTrackNumber
param.description: Music: The current number (1 based) of the track in the playback queue Podcast: The current number (1 based) of the episode in the playback queue Audiobook: The current number (1 based) of the episode in the playback queue (e.g. the chapter number in the book)

param.name: queueTotalTrackCount
param.description: Music: The total number of tracks in the playback queue Podcast: The total number of episodes in the playback queue Audiobook: The total number of sections in the playback queue (e.g. the number of chapters in the book)

struct.name: WeatherServiceData
struct.description: This data is related to what a weather service would provide

param.name: alerts
param.description: This array should be ordered with the first object being the current day

struct.name: AppServiceManifest
struct.description: This manifest contains all the information necessary for the service to be published, activated, and consumers able to interact with it

param.name: serviceName
param.description: Unique name of this service

param.name: serviceType
param.description: The type of service that is to be offered by this app

param.name: serviceIcon
param.description: The file name of the icon to be associated with this service. Most likely the same as the appIcon.

param.name: allowAppConsumers
param.description: If true, app service consumers beyond the IVI system will be able to access this service. If false, only the IVI system will be able consume the service. If not provided, it is assumed to be false.

param.name: uriPrefix
param.description: The URI prefix for this service. If provided, all PerformAppServiceInteraction requests must start with it.

param.name: uriScheme
param.description: This is a custom schema for this service. SDL will not do any verification on this param past that it has a correctly formated JSON Object as its base. The uriScheme should contain all available actions to be taken through a PerformAppServiceInteraction request from an app service consumer.

param.name: rpcSpecVersion
param.description: This is the max RPC Spec version the app service understands. This is important during the RPC passthrough functionality. If not included, it is assumed the max version of the module is acceptable.

param.name: handledRPCs
param.description: This field contains the Function IDs for the RPCs that this service intends to handle correctly. This means the service will provide meaningful responses.

struct.name: AppServiceRecord
struct.description: This is the record of an app service publisher that the module has. It should contain the most up to date information including the service's active state

param.name: serviceID
param.description: A unique ID tied to this specific service record. The ID is supplied by the module that services publish themselves.

param.name: serviceManifest
param.description: Manifest for the service that this record is for.

param.name: servicePublished
param.description: If true, the service is published and available. If false, the service has likely just been unpublished, and should be considered unavailable.

param.name: serviceActive
param.description: If true, the service is the active primary service of the supplied service type. It will receive all potential RPCs that are passed through to that service type. If false, it is not the primary service of the supplied type. See servicePublished for its availability.

struct.name: AppServiceData
struct.description: Contains all the current data of the app service. The serviceType will link to which of the service data objects are included in this object. (eg if service type equals MEDIA, the mediaServiceData param should be included.

element.name: PUBLISHED
element.description: The service has just been published with the module and once activated to the primary service of its type, it will be ready for possible consumption.

element.name: REMOVED
element.description: The service has just been unpublished with the module and is no longer accessible

element.name: ACTIVATED
element.description: The service is activated as the primary service of this type. All requests dealing with this service type will be handled by this service.

element.name: DEACTIVATED
element.description: The service has been deactivated as the primary service of its type

element.name: MANIFEST_UPDATE
element.description: The service has updated its manifest. This could imply updated capabilities

param.name: updateReason
param.description: Only included in OnSystemCapabilityUpdated. Update reason for service record.

param.name: updatedAppServiceRecord
param.description: Service record for a specific app service provider

struct.name: AppServicesCapabilities
struct.description: Capabilities of app services including what service types are supported and the current state of services.

param.name: appServices
param.description: An array of currently available services. If this is an update to the capability the affected services will include an update reason in that item

struct.name: SystemCapability
struct.description: The systemCapabilityType identifies which data object exists in this struct. For example, if the SystemCapability Type is NAVIGATION then a "navigationCapability" should exist

param.name: systemCapabilityType
param.description: Used as a descriptor of what data to expect in this struct. The corresponding param to this enum should be included and the only other para included.

param.name: navigationCapability
param.description: Describes extended capabilities for onboard navigation system

param.name: phoneCapability
param.description: Describes extended capabilities of the module's phone feature

param.name: videoStreamingCapability
param.description: Describes extended capabilities of the module's phone feature

param.name: remoteControlCapability
param.description: Describes extended capabilities of the module's phone feature

param.name: appServicesCapabilities
param.description: An array of currently available services. If this is an update to the capability the affected services will include an update reason in that item

function.name: RegisterAppInterface
function.description: Establishes an interface with a mobile application. Before registerAppInterface no other commands will be accepted/executed.

param.name: syncMsgVersion
param.description: See SyncMsgVersion

param.name: appName
param.description: The mobile application name, e.g. "Ford Drive Green". Needs to be unique over all applications. May not be empty. May not start with a new line character. May not interfere with any name or synonym of previously registered applications and any predefined blacklist of words (global commands) Needs to be unique over all applications. Applications with the same name will be rejected. Only characters from char set [@TODO: Create char set (character/hex value) for each ACM and refer to] are supported.

param.name: ttsName
param.description: TTS string for VR recognition of the mobile application name, e.g. "Ford Drive Green". Meant to overcome any failing on speech engine in properly pronouncing / understanding app name. Needs to be unique over all applications. May not be empty. May not start with a new line character. Only characters from char set [@TODO: Create char set (character/hex value) for each ACM and refer to] are supported.

param.name: ngnMediaScreenAppName
param.description: Provides an abbreviated version of the app name (if needed), that will be displayed on the NGN media screen. If not provided, the appName is used instead (and will be truncated if too long) Only characters from char set [@TODO: Create char set (character/hex value) for each ACM and refer to] are supported.

param.name: vrSynonyms
param.description: Defines an additional voice recognition command. May not interfere with any app name of previously registered applications and any predefined blacklist of words (global commands) Only characters from char set [@TODO: Create char set (character/hex value) for each ACM and refer to] are supported.

param.name: isMediaApplication
param.description: Indicates if the application is a media or a non-media application. Only media applications will be able to stream audio to the module that is audible outside of the BT media source.

param.name: languageDesired
param.description: See Language Current app's expected VR+TTS language If there is a mismatch with the module, the app will be able to change this registration with changeRegistration prior to app being brought into focus.

param.name: hmiDisplayLanguageDesired
param.description: See Language Current app's expected display language If there is a mismatch with the module, the app will be able to change this registration with changeRegistration prior to app being brought into focus.

param.name: appHMIType
param.description: See AppHMIType List of all applicable app HMI types stating which HMI classifications to be given to the app.

param.name: hashID
param.description: ID used to uniquely identify current state of all app data that can persist through connection cycles (e.g. ignition cycles). This registered data (commands, submenus, choice sets, etc.) can be reestablished without needing to explicitly reregister each piece. If omitted, then the previous state of an app's commands, etc. will not be restored. When sending hashID, all RegisterAppInterface parameters should still be provided (e.g. ttsName, etc.).

param.name: deviceInfo
param.description: See DeviceInfo.

param.name: appID
param.description: ID used to validate app with policy table entries

param.name: fullAppID
param.description: ID used to validate app with policy table entries

param.name: appInfo
param.description: See AppInfo.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

param.name: syncMsgVersion
param.description: See SyncMsgVersion

param.name: language
param.description: The currently active VR+TTS language on the module. See "Language" for options.

param.name: hmiDisplayLanguage
param.description: The currently active display language on the module. See "Language" for options.

param.name: displayCapabilities
param.description: See DisplayCapabilities

param.name: buttonCapabilities
param.description: See ButtonCapabilities

param.name: softButtonCapabilities
param.description: If returned, the platform supports on-screen SoftButtons; see SoftButtonCapabilities.

param.name: presetBankCapabilities
param.description: If returned, the platform supports custom on-screen Presets; see PresetBankCapabilities.

param.name: hmiZoneCapabilities
param.description: See HmiZoneCapabilities

param.name: speechCapabilities
param.description: See SpeechCapabilities

param.name: prerecordedSpeech
param.description: See PrerecordedSpeech

param.name: vrCapabilities

param.name: audioPassThruCapabilities
param.description: See AudioPassThruCapability

param.name: pcmStreamCapabilities
param.description: See AudioPassThruCapability

param.name: vehicleType
param.description: Specifies the vehicle's type. See VehicleType.

param.name: supportedDiagModes
param.description: Specifies the white-list of supported diagnostic modes (0x00-0xFF) capable for DiagnosticMessage requests. If a mode outside this list is requested, it will be rejected.

param.name: hmiCapabilities
param.description: Specifies the HMIs capabilities. See HMICapabilities.

param.name: sdlVersion
param.description: The SmartDeviceLink version.

param.name: systemSoftwareVersion
param.description: The software version of the system that implements the SmartDeviceLink core.

param.name: iconResumed
param.description: Existence of apps icon at system. If true, apps icon was resumed at system. If false, apps icon is not resumed at system

function.name: UnregisterAppInterface
function.description: Closes an interface from a mobile application. After unregisterAppInterface, no commands other than registerAppInterface will be accepted/executed. Will fail, if no registerAppInterface was completed successfully before.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: SetGlobalProperties
function.description: Allows setting global properties.

param.name: helpPrompt
param.description: The help prompt. An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: timeoutPrompt
param.description: Help text for a wait timeout. An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: vrHelpTitle
param.description: VR Help Title text. If omitted on supported displays, the default module help title shall be used. If omitted and one or more vrHelp items are provided, the request will be rejected.

param.name: vrHelp
param.description: VR Help Items. If omitted on supported displays, the default AppLink VR help / What Can I Say? screen shall be used. If the list of VR Help Items contains nonsequential positions (e.g. [1,2,4]), the RPC shall be rejected. If omitted and a vrHelpTitle is provided, the request will be rejected.

param.name: menuTitle
param.description: Optional text to label an app menu button (for certain touchscreen platforms).

param.name: menuIcon
param.description: Optional icon to draw on an app menu button (for certain touchscreen platforms).

param.name: keyboardProperties
param.description: On-screen keyboard configuration (if available).

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: ResetGlobalProperties
function.description: Allows resetting global properties.

param.name: properties
param.description: Contains the names of all global properties (like timeoutPrompt) that should be unset. Resetting means, that they have the same value as at start up (default)

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: AddCommand
function.description: Adds a command to the in application menu. Either menuParams or vrCommands must be provided.

param.name: cmdID
param.description: unique ID of the command to add.

param.name: menuParams
param.description: Optional sub value containing menu parameters

param.name: vrCommands
param.description: An array of strings to be used as VR synonyms for this command. If this array is provided, it may not be empty.

param.name: cmdIcon
param.description: Image struct determining whether static or dynamic icon. If omitted on supported displays, no (or the default if applicable) icon shall be displayed.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: DeleteCommand
function.description: Deletes all commands from the in-application menu with the specified command id.

param.name: cmdID
param.description: ID of the command(s) to delete.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: AddSubMenu
function.description: Adds a sub menu to the in-application menu.

param.name: menuID
param.description: unique ID of the sub menu to add.

param.name: position
param.description: Position within the items that are are at top level of the in application menu. 0 will insert at the front. 1 will insert at the second position. If position is greater or equal than the number of items on top level, the sub menu will be appended to the end. Position of any submenu will always be located before the return and exit options If this param was omitted the entry will be added at the end.

param.name: menuName
param.description: Text to show in the menu for this sub menu.

param.name: menuIcon
param.description: The image field for AddSubMenu

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: DeleteSubMenu
function.description: Deletes a submenu from the in-application menu.

param.name: menuID
param.description: The "menuID" of the submenu to delete. (See addSubMenu.menuID)

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: CreateInteractionChoiceSet
function.description: creates interaction choice set to be used later by performInteraction

param.name: interactionChoiceSetID
param.description: Unique ID used for this interaction choice set.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: PerformInteraction
function.description: Triggers an interaction (e.g. "Permit GPS?" - Yes, no, Always Allow).

param.name: initialText
param.description: Text to be displayed first.

param.name: initialPrompt
param.description: This is the initial prompt spoken to the user at the start of an interaction. An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: interactionMode
param.description: See InteractionMode.

param.name: interactionChoiceSetIDList
param.description: List of interaction choice set IDs to use with an interaction.

param.name: helpPrompt
param.description: Help text. This is the spoken string when a user speaks "help" when the interaction is occurring. An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: timeoutPrompt
param.description: Timeout text. This text is spoken when a VR interaction times out. An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: timeout
param.description: Timeout in milliseconds. If omitted a standard value of 10000 milliseconds is used. Applies only to the menu portion of the interaction. The VR timeout will be handled by the platform.

param.name: vrHelp
param.description: Ability to send suggested VR Help Items to display on-screen during Perform Interaction. If omitted on supported displays, the default generated list of suggested choices shall be displayed.

param.name: interactionLayout
param.description: See LayoutMode.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

param.name: choiceID
param.description: ID of the choice that was selected in response to PerformInteraction. Only is valid if general result is "success:true".

param.name: manualTextEntry
param.description: Manually entered text selection, e.g. through keyboard Can be returned in lieu of choiceID, depending on trigger source

param.name: triggerSource
param.description: See TriggerSource Only is valid if resultCode is SUCCESS.

function.name: DeleteInteractionChoiceSet
function.description: Deletes interaction choice set that has been created with "CreateInteractionChoiceSet".
The interaction may only be deleted when not currently in use by a "performInteraction".

param.name: interactionChoiceSetID
param.description: ID of the interaction choice set to delete.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: Alert
function.description: Shows an alert which typically consists of text-to-speech message and text on the display. At least either alertText1, alertText2 or TTSChunks need to be provided.

param.name: alertText1
param.description: The first line of the alert text field

param.name: alertText2
param.description: The second line of the alert text field

param.name: alertText3
param.description: The optional third line of the alert text field

param.name: ttsChunks
param.description: An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: duration
param.description: Timeout in milliseconds. Typical timeouts are 3-5 seconds. If omitted, timeout is set to 5s.

param.name: playTone
param.description: Defines if tone should be played. Tone is played before TTS. If omitted, no tone is played.

param.name: progressIndicator
param.description: If supported on the given platform, the alert GUI will include some sort of animation indicating that loading of a feature is progressing. e.g. a spinning wheel or hourglass, etc.

param.name: softButtons
param.description: App defined SoftButtons. If omitted on supported displays, the displayed alert shall not have any SoftButtons.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

param.name: tryAgainTime
param.description: Amount of time (in seconds) that an app must wait before resending an alert. If provided, another system event or overlay currently has a higher priority than this alert. An app must not send an alert without waiting at least the amount of time dictated.

function.name: Show
function.description: Updates the persistent display. Supported fields depend on display capabilities.

param.name: mainField1
param.description: The text that should be displayed in a single or upper display line. If this text is not set, the text of mainField1 stays unchanged. If this text is empty "", the field will be cleared.

param.name: mainField2
param.description: The text that should be displayed on the second display line. If this text is not set, the text of mainField2 stays unchanged. If this text is empty "", the field will be cleared.

param.name: mainField3
param.description: The text that should be displayed on the second "page" first display line. If this text is not set, the text of mainField3 stays unchanged. If this text is empty "", the field will be cleared.

param.name: mainField4
param.description: The text that should be displayed on the second "page" second display line. If this text is not set, the text of mainField4 stays unchanged. If this text is empty "", the field will be cleared.

param.name: alignment
param.description: Specifies how mainField1 and mainField2 texts should be aligned on display. If omitted, texts will be centered.

param.name: statusBar
param.description: Requires investigation regarding the nav display capabilities. Potentially lower lowerStatusBar, upperStatusBar, titleBar, etc.

param.name: mediaClock
param.description: Text value for MediaClock field. Has to be properly formatted by Mobile App according to the module's capabilities. If this text is set, any automatic media clock updates previously set with SetMediaClockTimer will be stopped.

param.name: mediaTrack
param.description: The text that should be displayed in the track field. If this text is not set, the text of mediaTrack stays unchanged. If this text is empty "", the field will be cleared.

param.name: graphic
param.description: Image struct determining whether static or dynamic image to display in app. If omitted on supported displays, the displayed graphic shall not change.

param.name: secondaryGraphic
param.description: Image struct determining whether static or dynamic secondary image to display in app. If omitted on supported displays, the displayed secondary graphic shall not change.

param.name: softButtons
param.description: App defined SoftButtons. If omitted on supported displays, the currently displayed SoftButton values will not change.

param.name: customPresets
param.description: App labeled on-screen presets (i.e. on-screen media presets or dynamic search suggestions). If omitted on supported displays, the presets will be shown as not defined.

param.name: metadataTags
param.description: App defined metadata information. See MetadataStruct. Uses mainField1, mainField2, mainField3, mainField4. If omitted on supported displays, the currently set metadata tags will not change. If any text field contains no tags or the none tag, the metadata tag for that textfield should be removed.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: Speak
function.description: Speaks a text.

param.name: ttsChunks
param.description: An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: SetMediaClockTimer
function.description: Sets the initial media clock value and automatic update method.

param.name: startTime
param.description: See StartTime. startTime must be provided for "COUNTUP" and "COUNTDOWN". startTime will be ignored for "RESUME", and "CLEAR" startTime can be sent for "PAUSE", in which case it will update the paused startTime

param.name: endTime
param.description: See StartTime. endTime can be provided for "COUNTUP" and "COUNTDOWN"; to be used to calculate any visual progress bar (if not provided, this feature is ignored) If endTime is greater then startTime for COUNTDOWN or less than startTime for COUNTUP, then the request will return an INVALID_DATA. endTime will be ignored for "RESUME", and "CLEAR" endTime can be sent for "PAUSE", in which case it will update the paused endTime

param.name: updateMode
param.description: Enumeration to control the media clock. In case of pause, resume, or clear, the start time value is ignored and shall be left out. For resume, the time continues with the same value as it was when paused.

param.name: audioStreamingIndicator
param.description: Enumeration for the indicator icon on a play/pause button. see AudioStreamingIndicator.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: PerformAudioPassThru
function.description: Starts audio pass thru session

param.name: initialPrompt
param.description: The module will speak this prompt before opening the audio pass thru session. An array of text chunks of type TTSChunk. See TTSChunk. The array must have at least one item. If omitted, then no initial prompt is spoken.

param.name: audioPassThruDisplayText1
param.description: First line of text displayed during audio capture.

param.name: audioPassThruDisplayText2
param.description: Second line of text displayed during audio capture.

param.name: samplingRate
param.description: This value shall be allowed at 8 kHz or 16 or 22 or 44 kHz.

param.name: maxDuration
param.description: The maximum duration of audio recording in milliseconds.

param.name: bitsPerSample
param.description: Specifies the quality the audio is recorded. Currently 8 bit or 16 bit.

param.name: audioType
param.description: Specifies the type of audio data being requested.

param.name: muteAudio
param.description: Defines if the current audio source should be muted during the APT session. If not, the audio source will play without interruption. If omitted, the value is set to true.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: EndAudioPassThru
function.description: When this request is invoked, the audio capture stops.

param.name: success
param.description: true if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: Slider
function.description: Creates a full screen or pop-up overlay (depending on platform) with a single user controlled slider.

param.name: numTicks
param.description: Number of selectable items on a horizontal axis

param.name: position
param.description: Initial position of slider control (cannot exceed numTicks)

param.name: sliderHeader
param.description: Text header to display

param.name: sliderFooter
param.description: Text footer to display (meant to display min/max threshold descriptors). For a static text footer, only one footer string shall be provided in the array. For a dynamic text footer, the number of footer text string in the array must match the numTicks value. For a dynamic text footer, text array string should correlate with potential slider position index. If omitted on supported displays, no footer text shall be displayed.

param.name: timeout
param.description: App defined timeout. Indicates how long of a timeout from the last action (i.e. sliding control resets timeout). If omitted, the value is set to 10000.

param.name: success
param.description: true, if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info

param.description: Fraction of distance till next maneuver (starting from when AlertManeuver is triggered). Used to calculate progress bar.

param.name: distanceToManeuverScale
param.description: Distance till next maneuver (starting from) from previous maneuver. Used to calculate progress bar.

param.name: maneuverComplete
param.description: If and when a maneuver has completed while an AlertManeuver is active, the app must send this value set to TRUE in order to clear the AlertManeuver overlay. If omitted the value will be assumed as FALSE.

param.name: softButtons
param.description: Three dynamic SoftButtons available (first SoftButton is fixed to "Turns"). If omitted on supported displays, the currently displayed SoftButton values will not change.

param.description: true, if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode

param.description: If omitted on supported displays, only the system defined "Close" SoftButton shall be displayed.

function.name: PutFile
function.description: Used to push a binary data onto the module from a mobile device, such as icons and album art Not supported on first generation of SDL enabled modules. Binary data is in binary part of hybrid msg.

param.name: syncFileName
param.description: File reference name.

param.name: fileType
param.description: Selected file type.

param.name: persistentFile
param.description: Indicates if the file is meant to persist between sessions / ignition cycles. If set to TRUE, then the system will aim to persist this file through session / cycles. While files with this designation will have priority over others, they are subject to deletion by the system at any time. In the event of automatic deletion by the system, the app will receive a rejection and have to resend the file. If omitted, the value will be set to false.

param.name: systemFile
param.description: Indicates if the file is meant to be passed thru core to elsewhere on the system. If set to TRUE, then the system will instead pass the data thru as it arrives to a predetermined area outside of core. If omitted, the value will be set to false.

param.name: offset
param.description: Optional offset in bytes for resuming partial data chunks

param.name: length
param.description: Optional length in bytes for resuming partial data chunks If offset is set to 0, then length is the total length of the file to be downloaded

param.name: crc
param.description: Additional CRC32 checksum to protect data integrity up to 512 Mbits

function.name: PutFile
function.description: Response is sent, when the file data was copied (success case). Or when an error occurred.
Not supported on first generation SDL enabled vehicles.

param.name: success
param.description: true, if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: spaceAvailable
param.description: Provides the total local space available in SDL Core for the registered app. If the transfer has systemFile enabled, then the value will be set to 0 automatically.

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

param.description: If subscribe is true, the head unit will register onInteriorVehicleData notifications for the requested moduleType. If subscribe is false, the head unit will unregister onInteriorVehicleData notifications for the requested moduleType. function.name: OnTBTClientState
function.description: Provides applications with notifications specific to the current TBT client status on the module

param.name: state
param.description: Current State of TBT client

function.name: OnDriverDistraction
function.description: Provides driver distraction state to mobile applications

param.name: state
param.description: Current State of Driver Distraction

function.name: OnPermissionsChange
function.description: Provides update to app of which policy-table-enabled functions are available

param.name: permissionItem
param.description: Change in permissions for a given set of RPCs

function.name: OnAudioPassThru
function.description: Binary data is in binary part of hybrid msg

param.name: language
param.description: Current SDL voice engine (VR+TTS) language

param.name: hmiDisplayLanguage
param.description: Current display language

function.name: OnKeyboardInput
function.description: On-screen keyboard event.
Can be full string or individual keypresses depending on keyboard mode.

param.name: event
param.description: On-screen keyboard input data.

param.name: data
param.description: On-screen keyboard input data.
For dynamic keypress events, this will be the current compounded string of entry text.
For entry submission events, this will be the full text entry (this will always return regardless of the mode).
For entry cancelled and entry aborted events, this data param will be omitted.

function.name: OnTouchEvent
function.description: Notifies about touch events on the screen's prescribed area

param.name: type
param.description: The type of touch event.

param.name: event
param.description: List of all individual touches involved in this event.

function.name: OnSystemRequest
function.description: An asynchronous request from the system for specific data from the device or the cloud or response to a request from the device or cloud Binary data can be included in hybrid part of message for some requests (such as Authentication request responses)

param.name: requestType
param.description: The type of system request.

param.name: requestSubType
param.description: This parameter is filled for supporting OEM proprietary data exchanges.

param.name: url
param.description: Optional URL for HTTP requests. If blank, the binary data shall be forwarded to the app. If not blank, the binary data shall be forwarded to the url with a provided timeout in seconds.

param.name: timeout
param.description: Optional timeout for HTTP requests Required if a URL is provided

param.name: fileType
param.description: Optional file type (meant for HTTP file requests).

param.name: offset
param.description: Optional offset in bytes for resuming partial data chunks

param.name: length
param.description: Optional length in bytes for resuming partial data chunks

function.name: OnHashChange
function.description: Notification containing an updated hashID which can be used over connection cycles (i.e. loss of connection, ignition cycles, etc.). Sent after initial registration and subsequently after any change in the calculated hash of all persisted app data.

param.name: hashID
param.description: Calculated hash ID to be referenced during RegisterAppInterface.

function.name: OnWayPointChange
function.description: Notification which provides the entire LocationDetails when there is a change to any waypoints or destination.

param.name: wayPoints
param.description: See LocationDetails

function.name: OnRCStatus
function.description: Issued by SDL to notify the application about remote control status change on SDL

param.name: allowed
param.description: If "true" - RC is allowed; if "false" - RC is disallowed.

param.name: allocatedModules
param.description: Contains a list (zero or more) of module types that are allocated to the application.

param.name: freeModules
param.description: Contains a list (zero or more) of module types that are free to access for the application.

function.name: OnAppServiceData
function.description: This notification includes the data that is updated from the specific service

function.name: OnSystemCapabilityUpdated
function.description: A notification to inform the connected device that a specific system capability has changed.

param.name: systemCapability
param.description: The system capability that has been updated

function.name: EncodedSyncPData
function.description: Allows encoded data in the form of SyncP packets to be sent to the SYNC module. Legacy / v1 Protocol implementation; use SyncPData instead. *** DEPRECATED ***

param.name: data
param.description: Contains base64 encoded string of SyncP packets.

param.name: success
param.description: true, if successful; false, if failed

param.name: resultCode
param.description: See Result

param.name: info
param.description: Provides additional human readable info regarding the result.

function.name: OnEncodedSyncPData
function.description: Callback including encoded data of any SyncP packets that SYNC needs to send back to the mobile device. Legacy / v1 Protocol implementation; responds to EncodedSyncPData. *** DEPRECATED ***

param.name: data
param.description: Contains base64 encoded string of SyncP packets.

param.name: URL
param.description: If blank, the SyncP data shall be forwarded to the app. If not blank, the SyncP data shall be forwarded to the provided URL.

param.name: Timeout
param.description: If blank, the SyncP data shall be forwarded to the app. If not blank, the SyncP data shall be forwarded with the provided timeout in seconds.
